text: The best of the best from Liang, bringing his men to help you fight!
One of the best, who is willing to work for you all for free!
Having failed at his own vie for hegemony, this former warlord now provides his services and his cavalry to one of your commanders. For one to twenty seasons, at least.
For unknown reasons, you swear that this fellow's name seems to randomly change every time you are introduced to him. Probably not worth thinking too hard about.
The knowledge and expertise of this grizzled soldier will be worth quite a bit to your general. At least 16 worth, in fact.
Life is like a hurricane, here on, the frontier...
Skilled at leading foreign archers, not bowing. But he presumably knows how to do that, too.
Once proud and independent, this noble's penance for submission is four years of service under one of your officers.
No, you fools! I said the POINTY end!
The mighty cavalry of the Wuhuan are yours to recruit! For the next four or so years, at least.
He promises this time not to rebel against you or the Han, cross his heart and hope to die. No backsies.
You didn't take this Xiongnu's life, but you did take his freedom.
Best not to ask why this fierce clan leader has a bare chest. People die asking stupid questions.
He is a Di and he's finding a path. A findy findy path, he's finding a path.
For some reason, whenever this sneaky individual plummets from a great height, a convenient bundle of straw awaits below to break his fall.
The greatest pirate you've never heard of.
I have my eyes... I have my cunning... and I have my strength.
In the jungle, the mighty jungle...
